verses.kjv: And the LORD called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
verses.web: LORD called to Moses, and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting. He said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man of you bring an offering unto the LORD, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, even of the herd, and of the flock.
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When anyone of you offers an offering to LORD, you shall offer your offering of the livestock, from the herd and from the flock.
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: When any of you brings an offering to the LORD, it must come from your livestock — either from your herds or your flocks.

verses.kjv: If his offering be a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD.
verses.web: “ ‘If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without defect. He shall offer it at the door of the Tent of Meeting, that he may be accepted before LORD.
verses.ct: If someone's offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he must bring a male animal with no defects. He is to present it willingly at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
verses.web: He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
verses.ct: He must place his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.

verses.kjv: And he shall kill the bullock before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: He shall kill the bull before LORD. Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall present the blood and sprinkle the blood around on the altar that is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: He must slaughter the bull before the LORD. Then the priests, Aaron's sons, will collect the blood and splash it on all sides of the altar at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.
verses.web: He shall skin the burnt offering, and cut it into pieces.
verses.ct: He must skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:
verses.web: The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar, and lay wood in order on the fire;
verses.ct: Aaron's sons, the priests, must build a fire on the altar and arrange wood on it.

verses.kjv: And the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:
verses.web: and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall lay the pieces, the head, and the fat in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar;
verses.ct: Then the priests, Aaron's sons, must arrange the pieces — including the head and the fat — on the wood burning on the altar.

verses.kjv: But his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, to be a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: but he shall wash its innards and its legs with water. The priest shall burn all of it on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: The person offering it must wash the internal organs and the legs with water. Then the priest will burn the entire animal on the altar as a burnt offering — an offering made by fire, producing an aroma that pleases the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if his offering be of the flocks, namely, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.
verses.web: “ ‘If his offering is from the flock, from the sheep or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall offer a male without defect.
verses.ct: If someone's offering is a burnt offering from the flock — whether a sheep or a goat — he must bring a male with no defects.

verses.kjv: And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar.
verses.web: He shall kill it on the north side of the altar before LORD. Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar.
verses.ct: He must slaughter it on the north side of the altar before the LORD. Then the priests, Aaron's sons, will splash its blood on all sides of the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:
verses.web: He shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat. The priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar,
verses.ct: He must cut it into pieces, including the head and the fat, and the priest will arrange them on the wood burning on the altar.

verses.kjv: But he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring it all, and burn it upon the altar: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: but the innards and the legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall offer the whole, and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: The person offering it must wash the internal organs and the legs with water. Then the priest will bring the whole animal and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering — an offering made by fire, producing an aroma that pleases the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the LORD be of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.
verses.web: “ ‘If his offering to LORD is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall offer his offering from turtledoves or of young pigeons.
verses.ct: If someone's burnt offering to the LORD is a bird, he must bring either a turtledove or a young pigeon.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:
verses.web: The priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head, and burn it on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out on the side of the altar;
verses.ct: The priest will bring it to the altar, twist off its head, and burn it on the altar. Its blood must be drained out against the side of the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:
verses.web: and he shall take away its crop and its feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes.
verses.ct: He must remove the crop along with its feathers and throw them on the east side of the altar, where the ashes are placed.

verses.kjv: And he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, but shall not divide it asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: He shall tear it by its wings, but shall not divide it apart. The priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: He must tear it open by its wings without pulling it completely apart. Then the priest will burn it on the altar, on the wood over the fire. It is a burnt offering — an offering made by fire, producing an aroma that pleases the LORD."
